snippet: This year, state officials began cataloging the bloodstained uniforms of both guards and inmates from the four-day uprising at Attica prison in 1971 to determine which items could be returned to the victims’ families.
abstract: New York State officials have finally completed cataloging bloodstained uniforms of both guards and inmates, barrels of baseball bats, a homemade cannon, makeshift knives and other ephemera from four-day Attica prison uprising of 1971; some personal belongings will be returned to victims’ families, and other artifacts discarded or retained for research or eventual display in New York State Museum.
lead_paragraph: This year, state officials began cataloging the bloodstained uniforms of both guards and inmates from the four-day uprising at Attica prison in 1971 to determine which items could be returned to the victims’ families.

headline.main: New York Is Cataloging, and Returning, Bloody Relics of 1971 Attica Assault
headline.print_headline: New York Is Cataloging, and Returning, Bloody Relics of 1971 Attica Assault
